title: How do I fight an adc like ashe/cait/vayne as a bruiser/tank during the late game
body: I feel so useless when i'm so tanky and stacked on resist but still get melted by the enemy adc, but this isn't a qq thread. As a gold 3 pleb I still don't understand the game a whole lot so how?

replies.body: You don't. You engage with your team and focus on keeping them from hitting your carries.

how about we say our carries arent doing so well but the jg and top laners are the ones fed that are the bruisers/tanks, and when I talk about them not doing so well I really mean it, it'd take a long time for them to get back up

So under the assumption your carries < their carries: that probably means your team fight is weaker than theirs (I'm not considering specific picks because it gets too game-specific). In this situation, you're best options are to:

* Set up a freeze in bot/top lane for the behind carry so they can farm up. Obviously, this means you sacrifice pressure on objectives, but that's a decision call that would need to be made.

* Set up a 1-3-1 push to keep their team split as best as possible. You're best off giving the 1's to good survivalists or people who can get away. 

* Try a miracle fight where you (the tank/bruiser) do your best to defend your carry or zone out their carry and pray your carry gets some kills. Best to try and do around objectives or when you outnumber their team. 

* Find picks. Always a good way to get gold for your carries. Requires good ward control.

An anti ad tank will have a pay day against most adcs apart from ashe untill she gets toned down and a fed jhin with that armour pen build.

Them felas include sejuani, rammus and malphite. What's special about them?
Sej: gains armour from passive, W provides very nice dps as she beefs up and she has awesome engage cc/sticking power.
Ram: taunt, built in thornmail, encourages armour stacking and rocks in a 1v1 situation. As long as you don't get blocked they're as good as gone.
Mal: atk speed slow, move speed steroid/slow and an almost undodgeable engage.

All 3 can get to an adc and stay on em with consistent damage. Only issue with all 3 is getting peeled.

This being randuins, dead mans, frozen heart, cinderhulk/sunfire, thornmail and boots/warmogs. (I personally sell boots and rely on dead mans and my cc to keep up). Yes armour won't stop vaynes w, but that's not the purpose. It's there to stop 2/3 aa and increase thornmail dmg.

But I'm going to skip some logical steps and just tell you about something relevant. In every relatively complex game no matter what it has been found that it is not possible to fully balance ranged vs nonranged. 

Some rules that derive from this problem of game design found in many games

1. ranged or melee will always be stronger in most realistic scenarios
2. the one that is not the strongest will need extra stats, bells, and whistles to function if the game is to feel balanced
3. in order for the game to feel fun and maybe to balance it (not going to speculate on necessity) there needs to be a specific condition that takes some work/strategy to reach in which melee can subdue ranged and take the advantage. 

There's some more but this gets the point across I think

In league 75-99% of random scenarios ranged is to start out with advantage and melee must actively find a way to acquire that 1-25% scenario and take the advantage. In some games like archeage (last I checked) its melee that gets this but ranged is pretty much immune to being touched or hit more than once every so many seconds (but lifesteal isn't a thing there so damage actually sticks)

Yasuo got nerfed because he was broken as hell on release (double his current shield duration, nearly double his E damage, higher base stats, higher ranges, faster flow gain, etc.). Nothing really special about that though.

not exactly. 

your job as a tank is to force the other team into a position where nailing one of the enemy carries with a primary CC (reliable), followed by a secondary CC (less reliable, often requires setup, but strong) and a ton of burst from your team's carries is possible. In many cases you also have the primary CC. 

you use your having either good primary CC or good damage as a threat to herd the other team into position. your defensive stats are there to keep you alive through the harass and punish attempts that you suffer through while posturing. 

As a full tank, often landing your full combo once in a fight is enough to dictate the results. full tanks don't run carries down or do too much mayhem to the back-lines. They either catch pray, or peel. having defensive stats is just to buy you the time you need to make that all important pick.
If you land CC, otherwise, you'd better splitpush.

or you actually find 1 to 3 damage items / hybrid damage+defense items to put in your build to help your team to burst down the carries as you should.

You have to get on them and cc/burst them, just like every other counter.  

This game sorta has a rock paper scissors thing going on.  
ADC is designed to kill pretty much anything in 10-20 autos (5-10 seconds let's say) late game cause they are the DPS source.  To counter that, you have the burst sources like mages, AD/AP assassins, and bruisers/fighters who can kill people with either little to no resistances or small health pools in 0.5-2 seconds.  To counter that (soft counter really), you have the tanks who are low damage but have high health/resistances with generally some form of CC and the supports who have some form of CC or some form of heal/shield all of which last maybe 1-3 seconds.

Obviously the ADC will win if given free reign to auto whoever they want without consequence, that's why there are so many people who can 1-shot them.  If your team isn't prioritizing the ADC and whoever is fed, they are going to lose.  Honestly, an ADC can go 0/10 but as long as they get the items they need and get peel, they will always be a threat.

As a tank, your job is to watch your team and try to get them to follow you when you engage and peel if your carries are being focused.  If that means you don't lock down the ADC, that's fine.  It's better to lock down the ulting Master Yi gunning for your ADC and remove him than get the enemy ADC and watch Yi clean up the fight afterwards.  

As a fighter though, it depends on who you play.  Irelia, for example, has a great gap closer and is meant to dive the backline and destroy a squishy.  So, for characters like her, you want to be looking for an opportunity where you can do that, preferably where the enemy team is busy focusing your tank so you can dive in and disrupt the backline without eating all the CC.

Then again, I play ADC a lot so this is mostly what I see and expect.  You can decide how you want to play though.
